item.title: "The white conservatives aren’t friends of the Negro...
item.content:encoded:
Abolish ICE Denver

"The white conservatives aren’t friends of the Negro either, but they at least don’t try to hide it. They are like wolves; they show their teeth in a snarl that keeps the Negro always aware of where he stands with them. But the white liberals are foxes, who also show their teeth to the Negro but pretend that they are smiling… One is the wolf, the other is a fox. No matter what, they’ll both eat you.” — Malcolm X

item.title: Call to Action! Stand with Sanctuary4All Colorado by calling on...
item.content:encoded:
Abolish ICE Denver

Call to Action!
Stand with Sanctuary4All Colorado by calling on Senator Hickenlooper to support immigrant communities!

This week, Senator Hickenlooper turned his back on the immigrant community in Colorado and around the country by supporting a move to block undocumented families from receiving COVID relief checks. While the vote was non-binding, he needs to hear from constituents that these decisions that hurt those most vulnerable to the pandemic will not be tolerated, bef...ore he does it again.

Sanctuary 4 All, a grassroots organization that advocates for the immigrant community in Colorado, has put out a call to action for Coloradans to voice their anger over Hickenlooper’s vote.

WHY: Coloradans elected Senator Hickenlooper to support everyone, regardless of their legal status. He needs to know that this is an unacceptable position to take and that we will hold him accountable.

HOW: Call Senator Hickenlooper today at 202-224-5941 to let him know that everyone deserves relief from the COVID-19 pandemic and that his actions matter to the people of Colorado.

SAMPLE SCRIPT:
My name is [FULL NAME] and I live in [COMMUNITY/ZIP CODE].
I am calling because I am deeply disturbed by Senator Hickenlooper’s vote to block undocumented families from receiving COVID relief checks. Everyone in Colorado and around the country deserves support during this pandemic, especially immigrant communities that can be even more vulnerable. As his constituent, I will continue to hold Hickenlooper accountable for all of his votes and demand that he support immigrant families.

GOAL: DSURJ’s goal is to generate at least 20 calls by the end of the weekend to send a clear message to Hickenlooper that we are watching each and every one of his votes.

Comment below to let us know you've reached out and please share!

See More

item.title: El Congresista Joe Neguse le invita a participar en una sesión...
item.content:encoded:
Abolish ICE Denver

El Congresista Joe Neguse le invita a participar en una sesión informativa virtual y bilingüe para hablar sobre las recientes órdenes ejecutivas sobre inmigración que firmó el presidente Joe Biden, así como nuevas propuestas de ley en el Congreso.

Esta sesión informativa se llevará a cabo en español y inglés con interpretación a los dos.

Panelistas:

...

• Rep. Joe Neguse, Congreso de los Estados Unidos
• Violeta R. Chapin, Profesora de Derecho, Escuela de Derecho de la Universidad de Colorado

• Marisa Molina, Directora Estatal para Colorado, fwd.us

• Jorge Loweree, Consejo Americano de Inmigración

• Johanna Ulloa, Biblioteca Pública de Poudre River/Consejo Asesor Latino del Rep. Neguse

Registrarse Aqui: neguse2021.com

Asegúrese de tener actualizada la última versión de Zoom para poder acceder a la función de interpretación. Y si planea unirse por teléfono, deberá usar la aplicación Zoom.

---

Congressman Joe Neguse invites you to join him for a bilingual town hall to discuss President Biden's recent executive orders on immigration, as well as proposed legislation.

This virtual event will be hosted in Spanish and English with interpretation for both languages.

Panelists:

• U.S. Congressman Joe Neguse

• Violeta R. Chapin, Clinical Professor of Law, University of Colorado Law School

• Marissa Molina, Colorado State Director, fwd.us

• Jorge Loweree, American Immigration Council

• Johanna Ulloa, Poudre River Public Library/Rep. Neguse Latino Advisory Council

Register here: neguse2021.com

Please make sure you have the latest version of Zoom updated, so that you can access the interpretation feature. And if you plan to join by phone, you will need to use the Zoom app.

See More

FRI, FEB 5

Bilingual Immigration Town Hall

item.title: Emergency call Today Senator Hickenlooper has started a bad...
item.content:encoded:
Abolish ICE Denver

Emergency call Today Senator Hickenlooper has started a bad journey in his role by giving his back to the immigrant community. By voting no on COVID relief checks for immigrant families that have no sort of economic support from our government. Clearly he does not care now that he has a home, he has food, he has medical insurance, a secure salary that his citizens pay including tax paying immigrants. His decisions harm a large number of people in Colorado and that is unaccept...able. Call his office in Washington and let him know that his decision was one of the biggest mistakes he could’ve made. 202-224-5941. We hope that he supports all his citizens in Colorado but also at a national level regardless of their legal status. The immigrant community in this pandemic is the most vulnerable in not being able to receive federal aid. Call and ask your acquaintances to show their indignation and anger upon this decision.

See More

Abolish ICE Denver

Not1More and AFSC member Hilda Martinez was captured by border patrol, leaving her children with their aunt and without aacces to a parent (their father was deported previously).

Hilda will see a judge tomorrow (Thursday) in New Mexico.

Hilda and her children came to some of the car rallies Abolish ICE Denver held this year and is a beloved member of the immigrant rights community!

item.title: "Hilda Martinez Murillo has four children, between the ages...
item.content:encoded:
Abolish ICE Denver

"Hilda Martinez Murillo has four children, between the ages of 5 and 14. She’s the sole provider and breadwinner since her husband, Ivan, was deported last year. Hilda is a community leader with the American Friends Service Committee in Colorado.

This past week, Hilda was in the El Paso area to visit family. On January 27, 2021 HIlda was traveling with other people in a vehicle and they were stopped at a Border Patrol checkpoint. She was arrested and is now charged with "smu...ggling Ixxxxxl aliens”. She is detained at he Dona Ana County Detention Center in New Mexico awaiting hearings this week. Funds will support her legal fees and her children.

Hilda is a quiet person in her daily life, but outspoken and fearless in the face of injustice. When her husband was detained by ICE and then held for 8 months at the GEO facility in Aurora, CO Hilda worked tirelessly to advocate for his release . The family helped to expose the lack of access to medical care and mishandling of contagious diseases in detention. At the beginning of the pandemic, she led #FreeThemAll calls to action at both detention centers and jails.

Even after her husband’s deportation, and despite the challenges of being a single mother, she remained committed to fighting for the human rights of all. She has testified in favor of bills at the state capitol and met with many Colorado congresspeople to advocate for just and humane immigration reform and the elimination of immigration detention centers. Most recently she advocated for the new congress to finally tackle an overhaul of our immigration policies, participating in two public direct actions in January alone.

Hilda’s own immigration case has been slowly winding through the system as she complies with everything asked of her. She applied for asylum as she is very afraid to return to Mexico due to persecution there and is currently in the US on humanitarian parole. Hilda was also the victim of a home invasion and attempted homicide here in the US while awaiting asylum. She has a UVISA application pending from this incident."

item.title: Grab your popcorn and snacks, and join us for a virtual showing...
item.content:encoded:
Abolish ICE Denver

Grab your popcorn and snacks, and join us for a virtual showing of The Undocumented Lawyer followed by a panel discussion with Lizbeth Mateo and Ingrid Encalada Latorre as they debrief the documentary and share their stories.

The Boulder County Sanctuary Coalition and Ingrid Encalada Latorre are organizing this showing as a fundraiser for the advocate/organizer position who works to support Ingrid, her family, and the Coalition. The Coalition has been awarded a matching gran...t of $7,500 from the Fund for Unitarian Universalist Social Responsibility to help support our efforts providing sanctuary to Ingrid and promoting her campaign No Mas Chuecos. We have already raised $2,500 and we need your help fundraising another $5,000. We are asking for a donation of $25 per person to attend the showing. Although, we will not turn anyone away.

A matching grant means every donation is doubled until we reach our goal so if you join us for the showing and donate $25, it automatically becomes $50! :)

If you are unable to attend the showing on Sun., Feb. 28th at 4 p.m., you can still participate. We will have access to the documentary and the panel discussion recording until Sat., March 6th so feel free to donate, and we will send everything out to you by email on Mon., March 1st.

If you have any questions, please feel free to contact us at teamingrid1@gmail.com

---------------------------------

Tome sus palomitas y su snack, y únase con nosotros para una exhibición virtual de The Undocumented Lawyer, seguida de un panel de discusión con Lizbeth Mateo e Ingrid Encalada Latorre donde van a comentar del documental y comparten sus historias.

La Coalición del Santuario del Condado de Boulder e Ingrid Encalada Latorre están organizando esta exhibición para recaudar fondos para el puesto de la organizadora que trabaja para apoyar a Ingrid, su familia y la Coalición. La Coalición ha recibido una beca de contrapartida de $7,500 del Fondo para la Responsabilidad Social Unitaria Universalista para ayudar con nuestros esfuerzos para apoyar a Ingrid y promover su campaña No Mas Chuecos. Ya hemos recaudado $2,500 y necesitamos su ayuda para recaudar otros $5,000. Solicitamos una donación de $25 por persona para asistir a la exhibición. Aunque, no rechazamos a nadie.

Una beca de contrapartida significa que cada donación se duplica hasta que logramos nuestra meta, por lo que si se une para la exhibición y dona $25, ¡automáticamente se convierte en $50! :)

Si usted no puede asistir en vivo el domingo 28 de febrero a las 4 p.m., aún puede participar. Tendremos acceso al documental y la grabación del panel de discusión hasta el sábado 6 de marzo, así que siéntase libre de donar, y le enviaremos todo por correo electrónico el lunes 1 de marzo.

Si tiene alguna pregunta, no dude en contactarnos en teamingrid1@gmail.com

item.title: Tania is selling enchiladas on February 6th with the Solidarity...
item.content:encoded:
Abolish ICE Denver

Tania is selling enchiladas on February 6th with the Solidarity Meals program. She arrived to the U.S. when she was just five years old, and through DACA she’s been able to pursue higher education, work for Denver Public Schools as a family liaison, and have a family of her own. She’s now applying for her residency, which is an incredibly expensive process, so she’s selling enchiladas this weekend to help raise money to cover the costs. You can order at https://solidaritymeals.paperform.co. Pickup will be in Denver this weekend, and money can be sent via Venmo to @/tania-baez-30. Place in Denver for pick up 1400 N Lafayette St Denver Co 80218 ready 1 pm https://solidaritymeals.paperform.co/…
item.author: Abolish ICE Denver
